title: Even chance (A)
creator_contributor_role: Curriculum Branch, Ministry of Ed, production company
Victoria. Office of the Commissioner for Equal Opportunity, production company
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.
subject_group: Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Discrimination in employment
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Victoria. Equal Opportunity Board
description: Alice, a young Aboriginal woman, leaves her home in a country town to work in the city. She finds employment but things start to go wrong and eventually she is dismissed. Alice decides to take her case to the Office of the Commissioner for Equal Opportunity. The program highlights examples of harassment, prejudice, stereotyping and discrimination.
